title: Give east coast players an advantage since we have to deal with crippling ping.
body:
I have played on high Diamond on NA and LAN (if you think my s4/s3 Diamond wasn't legit... then my s2 Diamond should suffice).

Even though in LAN the skill of players are worse, having a ping drop from 135 to 37 is massive. Not only is CSing, animation canceling, dodging skillshots, hitting skillshots, and walljumps are all easier... it also makes the game much smoother and fun.

I understand you are either too lazy or greedy to give us a viable server, but the least you can do is even out the playing field in some way.

Take a look at this image:
http://i.imgur.com/5OCTGvh.jpg

From both a personal experience, and from information that is available, it is obvious that if you live on the west coast... you have an advantage.

You cannot call yourself a competitive game until the majority of your population isn't struggling with third world pings.

Give us a gold advantage, or add a turn rate onto west coast players.

(BTW LoL in China has 27 servers across just that single country)

It's getting worse as time goes passes too, which makes it all the more awesome. In 2010, I'd expect to see around 80-90 ping at any given time on any given day. Now, If I'm at 130 I'm lucky, as it tends to sit around 150. I'm only living in Ohio...it's not like I'm that far away.

It's worked for Riot so far.

If you are going to use stats, use recent stats, not all time. 

In the past month, the average ping for challengers is 67 ping. And seeing that there are so many challengers who are pro players living in CA, there must be people above that line with ~100 ping who have made it into challenger to even out the average to 67.

I understand it sucks having a small amount of extra ping, but it is not holding anyone back from being challenger if they are good enough.

http://www.elophant.com/league-of-legends/charts/tier?region=na&period=month

#1 Most of the pros are from the west coast because they have an advantage on the ladders and so are more easily drafted to pro teams

#2 Faker would still be challenger if he lived in NY; however, given two equally skilled players, it is possible that the one that lived on the West Coast would be Challenger and the one on the East Coast would be D1

1 month of stats is enough imo. It shows what it is like now, in Challenger, and not what it was. It is possible *now* to get into challenger with east coast ping.

I also believe All Time stats are being skewed by something, seeing it is a full 30 ping below any monthly stat I have seen so far. Last month, I remember looking at the average monthly ping and it was around 80.

Either way, it is still possible to get into Challenger if you are good enough, ping is a very small factor. Especially if you are used to your ping.

You can get to challenger or wherever you want no matter where you live (Give or take if you are trying to play on NA from EU or something haha) but still why would anyone want a disadvantage in a competitive game? All I am saying is that there should be a server on the East Coast to compensate. It isn't an obscene proposition. I don't feel Riot is greedy or anything of the sort I just would like to point out that for the past few years they have been trying to address the issue from their end in Cali when just adding an East Coast server would solve most of the issues.

Server says "oh thing coming at you" (120ms)
you recognize and start to move (200ms?)
the server recognizes that you moved (120ms)

so... that little ping makes your response time about half a second... compared to Mr. West Coast with 30 ping... who can respond in quarter of a second.

I'm in central US with 106 ping all the time. There's no reason a gaming server for NA should be on the west coast. That's a terrible idea. There needs to be a server in central US, somewhere like Dallas, TX. This would make the most fair pings for the most of NA. It's better to have east and west coast players with an average of 80 ping and central players with lets say a 45 ping average than to screw over the central and east coast players. This will bring the overall combined ping down by a considerable amount for each match instead of giving all advantages to west side players and gradually disadvantaging players as you get further east. No location will be perfect for everyone, as ping != distance.. but putting the server in a location central to the players is a basic concept I figured RIOT would understand. Why isn't this taken care of, despite the game being out for so many years and being so popular?

"There needs to be a server in central US, somewhere like Dallas, TX. This would make the most fair pings for the most of NA."
